question.title: What is the typical indication for imaging examinations in abnormal puberty?
question.description: What is the standard diagnostic imaging study for abnormal puberty?

option_a.title: Pelvic ultrasound to evaluate for adrenal gland abnormalities
option_a.description: An imaging study to evaluate for adrenal gland abnormalities in girls with abnormal puberty

option_b.title: Brain MRI to look for a tumour affecting the hypothalamo-hypophyseal region
option_b.description: Imaging study to look for a tumour affecting the hypothalamo-hypophyseal region in girls with central precocious puberty

option_c.title: Pelvic ultrasound to evaluate for ovarian cysts
option_c.description: Imaging study to evaluate for ovarian cysts in girls with abnormal puberty

option_d.title: Bone age assessment via X-ray
option_d.description: Assessment of bone age via X-ray to evaluate pubertal development

correct_option.title: b
correct_option.description: The correct answer, indicating brain MRI to look for a tumour affecting the hypothalamo-hypophyseal region
